attributes.action: Stop Blackpool City Council from closing Blackpool Strip clubs
attributes.additional_details:
Since COVID-19 forced businesses to shut their doors for over 12 months now, it would be detrimental to not only the immediate staff - (dancers, bar staff, management, security staff etc) but also suppliers and business networks which of course compromises our wider economy. 
I am one of many who believe there is more to this than the "clean up" they claim it to be with comments of SEVs being "seedy in the extreme" and seems more like 'slut-shaming' at it's finest.
attributes.background: Following Bristol's recent attempts to ban strip clubs, Blackpool councillors are set to discuss a ban of their own as they believe it will "cut violence towards women" and "clean up" the image they have to become a more so-called "family holiday resort".

rejection.details:
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
